1.name: AVC conditions
1.desc: General conditions of transport 1983, latest revision laid down by the Stichting Vervoeradres The Hague.

2.name: Special agreement for parcels transport
2.desc: Appliance of a non published special agreement signed between a customer and the carrier (mandatory requested by the consignor) for parcels transport.

3.name: Special agreement for full loading transport
3.desc: Appliance of a non published special agreement signed between a customer and the carrier (mandatory requested by the consignor) for full load transport.

4.name: Combined transport
4.desc: A transport which involves more than one mode of transportation.

5.name: FIATA combined transport bill of lading
5.desc: Standard conditions of a combined transport bill of lading issued by FIATA.

6.name: Freight forwarders national conditions
6.desc: The contract and carriage conditions as established by freight forwarders on a national basis.

7.name: Normal tariff, parcels transport
7.desc: Appliance of the published legal tariff in case of parcels transport (required or not by the consignor.

8.name: Normal tariff, full loading transport
8.desc: Appliance of the published legal tariff in case of full load transport (required or not by the consignor).

9.name: Ordinary
9.desc: Carrier will choose the cheapest tariff in the legally published tariffs for parcels or full load transports (no tariff required by the consignor).

10.name: Port to port
10.desc: The transport will only be port to port, no inland transport would have to be provided under the contract.

11.name: CMR carnet
11.desc: Conditions in accordance with the convention of the contract for the international carriage of goods by road.

12.name: Special tariff, parcels transport
12.desc: Appliance of the legally published 'special' tariff in case or parcels transport (tariff requested by the consignor).

13.name: Special tariff, full transport
13.desc: Appliance of the legally published 'special tariff' in case of full load transport (tariff requested by the consignor).

14.name: Through transport
14.desc: The transport that is contracted not only from port to port, but from one inland location to another inland location.

15.name: Cancel space allocation
15.desc: Indication that space previously allocated on a flight is to be cancelled.

16.name: Report sale of space
16.desc: Indication that a sale has been made against a space allocation on a specific flight.

17.name: Alternative space allocation
17.desc: Indication that space is being requested for a specific flight and that an alternative is acceptable.

18.name: No alternative space allocation
18.desc: Indication that space is being requested for a specific flight and that an alternative is not acceptable.

19.name: Allotment sale
19.desc: Indication that space is being sold against a space allocation allotment on a specific flight.

20.name: Confirmation of space
20.desc: Indication that space requested has been confirmed on a specific flight.

21.name: Unable to confirm
21.desc: Indication that airline is unable to confirm the space allocation on a specific flight.

22.name: Non-operative flight
22.desc: Indication that airline is unable to confirm space on a specific flight since the flight does not operate.

23.name: Wait list
23.desc: Indication that the space allocation request has been assigned to a wait list.

24.name: Prior space allocation request
24.desc: Indication that a space allocation on a specific flight has already been requested.

25.name: Holding confirmed space allocation
25.desc: Indication that space is being held as confirmed on a specific flight.

26.name: Holding wait list
26.desc: Indication that space allocation request on a specific flight has been assigned to a wait list.

27.name: Door-to-door
27.desc: The carrier is responsible for the intermodal carriage of cargo including both the pre-carriage and the on- carriage.

28.name: Door-to-pier
28.desc: The carrier is responsible for the intermodal carriage of cargo including the pre-carriage, but excluding the on-carriage.

29.name: Pier-to-door
29.desc: The carrier is responsible for the intermodal carriage of cargo including the on-carriage, but excluding the pre-carriage.

30.name: Pier-to-pier
30.desc: The carrier of intermodal cargo is only responsible for the main carriage.

31.name: Space cancellation noted
31.desc: Indication that space previously allocated on a means of transport has been cancelled.

32.name: Mini landbridge service
32.desc: Cargo moving from a coastal port for delivery at an inland location or cargo received at an inland location moving to a coastal port for subsequent ocean transportation.

34.name: Speed level - required
34.desc: Maximum speed required on an itinerary or part of this itinerary to be able to assume some services.

35.name: Speed level - adopted
35.desc: Real speed used on an itinerary or part of this itinerary (for technical reasons, some limitation can be imposed or some higher speed could be used).

36.name: Normal tariff, less than full load transport
36.desc: Application of the published legal tariff in case of less than full load transport (required or not by the consignor).

37.name: Re-expedition special tariff
37.desc: Indication that a special tariff must be used in the case of a re-expedition.

38.name: Transport arrangement by the requester
38.desc: The service requester has the responsibility of making transport arrangement.

39.name: Transport arrangement by the provider
39.desc: The service provider has the responsibility of making transport arrangement.

40.name: Transport arrangement by the patient
40.desc: The patient has the responsibility of making transport arrangement.
